entry.title: Why not Child-Pays-For-Parent?
entry.summary: According to the given context, it is revealed that the lack of unit tests is the only thing holding up a certain project. It is expected that if someone implements these tests, the project will be merged soon after. However, there is another issue that needs to be addressed, which is getting the parent transactions relayed even when they fail the relay policy on their own. The context seems to be related to some kind of software development or programming project. The mention of "unit tests" suggests that the project is being developed using an Agile methodology, where unit testing is an essential part of the process. It is also evident that the project has multiple contributors who are working together to get it completed. Overall, the context suggests that there are two main issues that need to be resolved before the project can progress further. The first one is related to the lack of unit tests, and the second one is related to the relay policy for parent transactions. Therefore, it is important to find solutions to these issues in order to move the project forward.
